sentence.Network_en: Recent, more dramatic use of CGI was seen in "Walking With Dinosaurs".
sentence.Network_cn: 在纪录片《与恐龙同行》中可以看到最新的、更加生动的电脑特效技术。

sentence.Network_en: The worms cannot be seen by the naked eye.
sentence.Network_cn: 这些虫子用肉眼看不见。

sentence.Network_en: Fox, badger, weasel and stoat are regularly seen here.
sentence.Network_cn: 狐狸、獾、黄鼠狼和白鼬在这里很常见。

entry.def: Seen is the past participle of see.

auth_sentence.content: Now it's seen as glamorous, even sophisticated.
auth_sentence.res_content: Now it's seen as glamorous, even sophisticated.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Now it's seen as glamorous, even sophisticated.

auth_sentence.content: Whether we develop a rivalry remains to be seen.
auth_sentence.res_content: Whether we develop a rivalry remains to be seen.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Whether we develop a rivalry remains to be seen.

auth_sentence.content: Since its launch Twitter has obviously seen rapid growth.

Sentence.sentence: What it does mean is that the book business will go through a transformation in the next decade or so more profound than any it has seen since Gutenberg introduced printing from moveable type in the 1450s.
The increase of e-book sales will force the book business to make changes not seen for centuries.
According to the author, whether digital textbooks will catch on still remains to be seen.
Extreme weather and reckless development arc plotting against the rain forest in ways that scientists have never seen.
We have all seen how a computer's use of personal names often fascinates people and needs them to treat the machine as if it were almost human.

sentences.en: That jacket of yours has seen better days—isn’t it time you bought a new one?
sentences.cn: 你那件夹克衫可是有年头了—是不是该买件新的了？

means.word_mean: 不会去做某事(以免露怯或尴尬)

sentences.en: I wouldn’t be seen dead in a hat like that.
sentences.cn: 我不愿意戴那样的帽子出洋相。
